title: By the Council of State. A proclamation. Whereas by an act of the last Parliament, intituled, An act for dissolving the Parliament begun the third of November 1640, and for the calling and holding of a Parliament at Westminster the 25 of April 1660. ...
author: England and Wales. Council of State.
publisher: Printed by Abel Roper, and Tho: Collins, Printers to the Council of State,
notes: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
Date and place of publication from Wing.

"Recites provisions of Act for summoning Parliament. No rebel in Ireland, nor any one who has made war on Parliament, nor their sons, may be elected. This to be proclaimed at the time and place of electing, before the elections." -- Cf. Steele.
Dated at end: Wednesday March 28. 1660. By the Council of State at VVhitehal.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
